To the chief Musician<S>5329</S>, to Jeduthun<S>3038</S>, A Psalm<S>4210</S> of Asaph<S>623</S>. I cried<S>6817</S> unto God<S>430</S> with my voice<S>6963</S>, even unto God<S>430</S> with my voice<S>6963</S>; and he gave ear<S>238</S> unto me. <sup>of: or, for</sup>
In the day<S>3117</S> of my trouble<S>6869</S> I sought<S>1875</S> the Lord<S>136</S>: my sore<S>3027</S> ran<S>5064</S> in the night<S>3915</S>, and ceased<S>6313</S> not: my soul<S>5315</S> refused<S>3985</S> to be comforted<S>5162</S>. <sup>sore: Heb. hand</sup>
I remembered<S>2142</S> God<S>430</S>, and was troubled<S>1993</S>: I complained<S>7878</S>, and my spirit<S>7307</S> was overwhelmed<S>5848</S>. Selah<S>5542</S>.
Thou holdest<S>270</S> mine eyes<S>5869</S> waking<S>8109</S>: I am so troubled<S>6470</S> that I cannot speak<S>1696</S>.
I have considered<S>2803</S> the days<S>3117</S> of old<S>6924</S>, the years<S>8141</S> of ancient times<S>5769</S>.
I call to remembrance<S>2142</S> my song<S>5058</S> in the night<S>3915</S>: I commune<S>7878</S> with mine own heart<S>3824</S>: and my spirit<S>7307</S> made diligent search<S>2664</S>.
Will the Lord<S>136</S> cast off<S>2186</S> for ever<S>5769</S>? and will<S>3254</S> he be favourable<S>7521</S> no more?
Is his mercy<S>2617</S> clean gone<S>656</S> for ever<S>5331</S>? doth his promise<S>562</S> fail<S>1584</S> for evermore<S>1755</S> <S>1755</S>? <sup>for evermore: Heb. to generation and generation?</sup>
Hath God<S>410</S> forgotten<S>7911</S> to be gracious<S>2589</S>? hath he in anger<S>639</S> shut up<S>7092</S> his tender mercies<S>7356</S>? Selah<S>5542</S>.
And I said<S>559</S>, This is my infirmity<S>2470</S>: but I will remember the years<S>8141</S> of the right hand<S>3225</S> of the most High<S>5945</S>.
I will remember<S>2142</S> <S>2142</S> the works<S>4611</S> of the LORD<S>3050</S>: surely I will remember<S>2142</S> thy wonders<S>6382</S> of old<S>6924</S>.
I will meditate<S>1897</S> also of all thy work<S>6467</S>, and talk<S>7878</S> of thy doings<S>5949</S>.
Thy way<S>1870</S>, O God<S>430</S>, is in the sanctuary<S>6944</S>: who is so great<S>1419</S> a God<S>410</S> as our God<S>430</S>?
Thou art the God<S>410</S> that doest<S>6213</S> wonders<S>6382</S>: thou hast declared<S>3045</S> thy strength<S>5797</S> among the people<S>5971</S>.
Thou hast with thine arm<S>2220</S> redeemed<S>1350</S> thy people<S>5971</S>, the sons<S>1121</S> of Jacob<S>3290</S> and Joseph<S>3130</S>. Selah<S>5542</S>.
The waters<S>4325</S> saw<S>7200</S> thee, O God<S>430</S>, the waters<S>4325</S> saw<S>7200</S> thee; they were afraid<S>2342</S>: the depths<S>8415</S> also were troubled<S>7264</S>.
The clouds<S>5645</S> poured out<S>2229</S> water<S>4325</S>: the skies<S>7834</S> sent out<S>5414</S> a sound<S>6963</S>: thine arrows<S>2687</S> also went abroad<S>1980</S>. <sup>poured: Heb. were poured forth with water</sup>
The voice<S>6963</S> of thy thunder<S>7482</S> was in the heaven<S>1534</S>: the lightnings<S>1300</S> lightened<S>215</S> the world<S>8398</S>: the earth<S>776</S> trembled<S>7264</S> and shook<S>7493</S>.
Thy way<S>1870</S> is in the sea<S>3220</S>, and thy path<S>7635</S> in the great<S>7227</S> waters<S>4325</S>, and thy footsteps<S>6119</S> are not known<S>3045</S>.
Thou leddest<S>5148</S> thy people<S>5971</S> like a flock<S>6629</S> by the hand<S>3027</S> of Moses<S>4872</S> and Aaron<S>175</S>.
